title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > Review System Logs and Perform Checks in Diagnostics Menu
content: In the **Diagnostics** menu, review the system logs on the gateway and perform checks.
parent_content: In the **Diagnostics** menu, review the system logs on the gateway and perform checks.

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > System Log > System Log Tab Overview for Debugging
content:
The **System log** tab displays complete system-level logs, primarily used for debugging and troubleshooting.  
The **Auto refresh** switch in the top right corner turns automatic log updates on or off.  
> **Image:** System log tab
parent_content:
The **System log** tab displays complete system-level logs, primarily used for debugging and troubleshooting.  
The **Auto refresh** switch in the top right corner turns automatic log updates on or off.  
> **Image:** System log tab

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > System Log > Download System Log > Download System Logs in wisgateos2
content:
To download system logs, follow these steps:  
1. Navigate to **Settings** > **File browser**.  
> **Image:** File browser  
2. Go to **mmcblk0p1** > **syslog**.  
> **Image:** syslog  
3. Select the log file based on the timestamp and click to download.
parent_content:
To download system logs, follow these steps:  
1. Navigate to **Settings** > **File browser**.  
> **Image:** File browser  
2. Go to **mmcblk0p1** > **syslog**.  
> **Image:** syslog  
3. Select the log file based on the timestamp and click to download.

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > System Log > Configure System Log > Configure Log Storage or Forwarding in wisgateos2
content: If you need to configure log storage settings or forward logs to an external server, refer to the **[Configuring System Log](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/software-apis-and-libraries/wisgateos2/settings/#configure-the-system-log)** section.
parent_content: If you need to configure log storage settings or forward logs to an external server, refer to the **[Configuring System Log](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/software-apis-and-libraries/wisgateos2/settings/#configure-the-system-log)** section.

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > Network Utilities > Network Utilities for Troubleshooting
content:
The **Network utilities** page provides built-in diagnostic tools for network troubleshooting. These tools allow you to check connectivity, trace network routes, and perform DNS lookups directly from the gateway.  
> **Image:** Network utilities tab
parent_content:
The **Network utilities** page provides built-in diagnostic tools for network troubleshooting. These tools allow you to check connectivity, trace network routes, and perform DNS lookups directly from the gateway.  
> **Image:** Network utilities tab

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > Network Utilities > Available Tools > Network Diagnostic Commands [TABLE]
content:
- **Ping**: Tests the reachability of a host by sending ICMP echo request packets and measuring response times. This helps determine if a device or server is online.
- **Trace**: Displays the route packets take to reach a destination, showing the intermediate hops. Useful for identifying network latency or connection issues.
- **Nslookup**: Queries the Domain Name System (DNS) to obtain the IP address corresponding to a domain name or vice versa.
parent_content:
- **Ping**: Tests the reachability of a host by sending ICMP echo request packets and measuring response times. This helps determine if a device or server is online.
- **Trace**: Displays the route packets take to reach a destination, showing the intermediate hops. Useful for identifying network latency or connection issues.
- **Nslookup**: Queries the Domain Name System (DNS) to obtain the IP address corresponding to a domain name or vice versa.

title: WisGateOS 2 User Manual | Complete Guide for LoRaWAN Gateway Software > Diagnostics > Network Utilities > How to Use > Using Network Tools (Ping, Trace, Nslookup) in wisgateos2
content:
1. Enter an **IPv4 Address** or **Hostname** in the input field.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
For **Nslookup**, only a domain name is allowed.  
2. Pick your desired tool:  
- **Ping** to check connectivity.
- **Trace** to view the routing path.
- **Nslookup** to resolve domain names.  
3. The results will be displayed in the console output area below.
parent_content:
1. Enter an **IPv4 Address** or **Hostname** in the input field.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
For **Nslookup**, only a domain name is allowed.  
2. Pick your desired tool:  
- **Ping** to check connectivity.
- **Trace** to view the routing path.
- **Nslookup** to resolve domain names.  
3. The results will be displayed in the console output area below.
